Ideally, this app needs location permissions in order to accurately calculate the zmanim. Therefore, it is better to allow the app to see your location. We do not use your location for any other purpose than to calculate the zmanim.

(Note: As of Android 11, the app can not ask you for location permissions more than once per install. You might need to re-install the app to use your location.) 

However, if you still do not want to give location permissions, you can choose to enter a zipcode and the app will try to find your location.

I have heard from Rabbi Darshan (creator of the Ohr HaChaim Luach in Israel) that Rabbi Ovadiah Yosef ZT\"L held that the actual sunrise/sunset that should be used for calculating zmanim is when sunrise/sunset is seen at the highest point in the city. However, Rabbi David Yosef Shlita writes that many have told him that Rabbi Ovadiah ZT\"L held to use Mishor (Sea Level) sunrise/sunset. Therefore, you can use the buttons below to choose the appropriate settings that you want. (See Halacha Berura vol. 14, in Otzrot Yosef (Kuntrus Ki Ba Hashemesh), Siman 6, Perek 21 for an in depth discussion)

Welcome to the Rabbi Ovadiah Yosef Calendar App, this app was made to help you find out the most accurate zmanim of the day according to Rabbi Ovadiah Yosef ZT"L for your own city! There are a few things to know before using the app.


1.) Setup elevation and visible sunrise for where you are currently located. In this first step, you should ideally find your city on chaitables.com and download the visible sunrise tables. Through the quick setup, the elevation data will automatically be downloaded as well. This table contains the most accurate times for VISIBLE sunrise, and this is the algorithm that the Ohr HaChaim calendar uses in Israel. However, these tables only go on for 2 years into the future and will need to be updated bi-yearly. If you do not want to use these tables, you can choose not to download them through the advanced menu, and the app will instead use the regular algorithm for sunrise (without elevation included).


2.) There are a few different minhagim to choose from in the settings part of the app. Make sure to choose the correct ones for your city/kehila. For example, the default candle lighting time is set to 20 minutes before sunset, and the default end time for is set to 45 minutes after sunset. Please change these settings to your own customs.


3.) Lastly, the zmanim will be included with seconds, DO NOT RELY ON THESE SECONDS. The only zman that can be relied on to the second is the visible sunrise time based on chaitables.com. Otherwise, these zmanim are NOT accurate to the second! You should always round up or down a minute or two just in case.


In addition to all of this, there are features in place that will tell you when to update the elevation data or the visible sunrise tables. If you leave the city that you currently setup the app for, the app will prompt you to run the setup again. The reason for this feature is because elevation will change based on the city that you are located in and you will have to update it every time you change cities, however, this feature will only turn on if you use elevation. 

There is a similar feature for the visible sunrise tables that will prompt you to update the tables when the Rosh Hashana comes around. This is because the tables use the hebrew calendar and the website only allows you to download the times for the current year and the next year. Therefore, you need to download the new tables every year or two.

Welcome!

The goal of this app is to help you create your own zmanim calendar according to Rabbi Ovadiah Yosef Z"tl as accurately as possible. This app was made to teach people how zmanim are calculated and therefore it might seem confusing/not user friendly at first, however, I wanted to make sure people were getting what they wanted.

There are 2 options in order to setup the zmanim.

The "Quick Setup" option will setup the calendar according to the way that the Ohr HaChaim calendar, in Israel, sets it's zmanim. Pressing the Quick Setup button will take you to a button that will do 2 things. It will take you to a website that has a list of cities to calculate zmanim. Once you choose your city, it will download the elevation data for your city from the website. It will also download a table that lists the times for VISIBLE sunrise throughout the next 2 years.

The "Advanced Setup" option allows you to choose whether you want to download the elevation data for your city, or the visible sunrise tables, or neither one.

Know that the elevation data changes for each and every city and you will need to download the elevation data of your city from the ChaiTables website every time you change cities.

\Why is the website needed? Because it is not easy to calculate the highest point of elevation in your city without detailed information of the entire city's elevation level, which would be too much data for this app. 

Note: Not every city will be available through chaitables, however, you should be able to request it to be added to the website if needed.
